alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion; Pickens; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 3:37PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Fayette, Lamar, Marion, Pickens and Winston. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 337 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area, with locally higher amounts. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hamilton, Winfield, Fayette, Haleyville, Aliceville, Vernon, Sulligent, Reform, Millport, Carrollton, Lynn, Pickensville, Guin, Hackleburg, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Kennedy, Detroit, Belk and Beaverton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
